definition: to seek/to strive for/to obtain/see also 牟取[mou2 qu3]

sentences.english: This short term make-a-fast-buck philosophy has killed this country.
sentences.chinese: “谋取近利”这一指导思想已经扼杀了这个国家。

sentences.english: Corruption is the use of governmental powers by government officials for illegitimate private gain.
sentences.chinese: 腐败是利用政府权力，政府官员为非法谋取私利。

sentences.english: In ancient times there was a country magistrate who took bribes and practised graft.
sentences.chinese: 古时候有一个县官，贪污受贿，谋取私利。

sentences.english: The fact that he'd been in prison militated against his chances of getting a job in a bank.
sentences.chinese: 蹲过监狱这件事影响他谋取银行职位的机会。

sentences.english: In war we must always leave room for strokes of fortune, and accidents that cannot be foreseen – Polybius.
sentences.chinese: 战争中我们为谋取财富而离乡背井，前途叵测。

sentences.english: The provinces start to take advantage of the Empire's weakened state.
sentences.chinese: 但其他的行省开始在帝国式微之下谋取各自的利益。

sentences.english: All the misunderstanding honor the benefit of using his honor thoroughly frustrated, .
sentences.chinese: 全误会荣利用自己谋取利益，对荣彻底失望。

sentences.english: Exploiting your assets for personal gain.
sentences.chinese: 利用您的资产谋取私利。

sentences.english: At present, Tanzania is at the centre of the world's ivory slaughter.
sentences.chinese: 目前，坦桑尼亚是世界屠宰大象谋取象牙的中心。

sentences.english: Right rent seeking of inspector means to put privacy into the public right to obtain money and material interests.
sentences.chinese: 权力寻租者将公权化为私权，以谋取金钱和物质利益。

sentences.english: They jockey for the leaderships of the party.
sentences.chinese: 他们不择手段谋取党的领导权。

sentences.english: The houses have become a few rich people's means of cornering and profiteering.
sentences.chinese: 住宅成了少数一些富人囤积居奇谋取暴利的手段。

sentences.english: Using other people for one's own profit is unethical.
sentences.chinese: 利用别人来谋取私利是不道德的。

definition: to gain profit (by underhand means)/to exploit/see also 謀取|谋取[mou2 qu3]
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
to fish for/to seek profit (by improper means)
to make a profit/to earn a packet
to gain profit (by underhand means)/to exploit/exploitation
to obtain (sth) in exchange/to exchange (sth) for (sth else)
to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
to accumulate wealth/to rake in money
to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
